meanings.definition: To surpass in handling or managing
meanings.sent1: She outhandled her opponent in the tennis match.
meanings.sent2: The experienced chef outhandled the new trainee in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: Despite his clumsy appearance, he surprisingly outhandled the delicate equipment.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking and decisive actions allowed her to outhandle the crisis.
meanings.sent5: The skilled juggler outhandled the difficult routine with ease.

meanings.definition: To outdo in skill or efficiency in handling
meanings.sent1: He outhandled his competitors in the sales pitch.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic outhandled the tricky engine problem in no time.
meanings.sent3: The magician outhandled the disappearing act, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: She outhandled the challenging task with grace and precision.
meanings.sent5: The detective outhandled the case, solving it in record time.

meanings.definition: The act of surpassing in handling or managing
meanings.sent1: Her outhandling of the situation impressed everyone in the office.
meanings.sent2: The team's outhandling of the project led to its success.
meanings.sent3: The robot's outhandling of the assembly line tasks was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: His outhandling of the crisis saved the company from disaster.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's outhandling of the ball was crucial in winning the game.
